message: So I want to put a reed switch on the door (we have some) and then send it to twitter when ever anyone opens the door.
Actually, if someone wants to take this project and just do it, there is an arduino and a network shield at the space.
Wireless or wired? I can't make heads or tails of these WiShields. Are they defective, or am I?
Wired is fine, the hub is right there.
How is this going?  I kinda wanna do something like this over at NESIT.
Let's get this started.  Can we hook up the rfid so we can identify ppl?
and by do something like this, i mean the exact same thing. :P
Also, any interface into the opener we can use?
Ari has the parts in a box (ethernet shield, arduino and reed switch)  I think that is all that is needed.
Soliciting ideas for naming the twitter account.  I reject A1Door, because this project may grow to encompass other data.  (Temperature?  Status of Heat/AC/Soda Machine...) @A1Bot ?
I took delivery of the Arduino/Shield.  This will be my first Arduino Project.
@Psytek You said the specifications for the touchscreen door lock (Samsung?) were online?  What is the model number?
Isn't it labeled? Hmmm... I don't remember seeing any labels...
Cool! Let me know if I can help!

@A1Ari Hmm, actually just the instruction manual is online, not really specs.  I did notice a JTAG interface... The lock is Samsung SHS-3120 We can test on another lock before implementing anything on our lock.  A1Bot is good.
:( Still having trouble getting drivers/Arduino dev environment to recognize the Duemilanove w/ Mega328.  Failed on win7x64 and on my vmware WinXPx32.  I am annoyed.
Don't have an UNO? Around? Or Decimilia?

I'll ask around.  I tried a couple of cables, so I think I eliminated that as a suspect.  I'd kinda like to try a different Atmega328 in this board to isolate that.  I'll ask around.  I'm contemplating purchasing a Uno.  $30 shipped w/ Amazon prime.

I bought a Duemilanove, $25 (free shipping with Amazon Prime.)  They had Uno's for $5 more, but hey five bucks is five bucks...  I didn't go with an SMT, because I want to be able to swap the Atmegas.
I, too, am an Amazon Prime junkie, but there are better dealers of such things - some with lower all-around pricing. UNO is available again as not SMT also.

There is a new Arduino twitter library out.  The old library required an intermediary server to publish tweets.  The intermediary server (appspot.com) handled the oAuth stuff.  This library seems to do it on the Arduino.  http://www.markkurossi.com/ArduinoTwitter/
I want to wire up the donation box and laser cutter into it too with the bill acceptor
yeah, I'm hoping we can put some jumpers on the Carduinos and make them work
if AJay's around I'll ask him, or if Konstantin visits
Did you see the Prowl project on Makezine?  That might be worth considering also
we need more aduinos
oh, totally!
Want to schedule a Carduino workshop too?  Maybe have it during Summercon?
do any of those wifi shields work?
I can bring in my Uno if it's not in one of my plastic tubs
sounds good
How about some of that $100/Month going towards an Arduino Mega, etc.? Maybe Wing Shield or Multiplexing accessory?
Sounds good
I'm going to do a blog post about it   Its for everyone, even non-members to add to.
